page.title: 15The Reservoir, St. Peter
page.content: The reservoir in Val de la Mare valley was planned during the later 1950s and built in the early 1960s. The site was a wild valley of luxuriant valley vegetation and gorse. It had not been used for anything since the Germans built their railway from Ronez Quarries down to the defence works they were creating in St Ouen's Bay in the middle years of the Second World War. The track was never used after the Germans left. Since building the reservoir, the waterworks company have laid a path from its head to the dam. This is a popular walk for people. The reservoir is also stocked with trout (Rainbow and Brown) and used on a licence basis for fishing.
